title: Bartender
description:
Position Overview:
**Now Hiring! Bartender**  

**Full Time**  

**Salary: $21 - $25 per Hour** **Job Summary:**  

The Bartender at Alpine Country Club is responsible for providing exceptional service by preparing and serving high-quality beverages to our guests. The primary objective is to ensure every guest has a memorable experience that encourages them to return. **Activities and Responsibilities:****Primary:*** Prepare and serve alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages following the restaurant’s standard recipes.
* Verify guests' age by checking identification to comply with alcohol service regulations.
* Present drink menus, make recommendations, and answer questions about beverages.
* Take food and beverage orders from serving staff or directly from bar guests.
* Mix ingredients to prepare cocktails and other drinks accurately and efficiently.
* Serve snacks or food items to bar guests.
* Record drink orders promptly and accurately in the register system.
* Balance receipts and cash transactions.
* Learn and address regular guests by name, fostering a welcoming atmosphere.
* Monitor and manage alcohol consumption to prevent over-serving, offering alternative transportation if necessary.
* Clean and sanitize glasses, utensils, and bar equipment.
* Maintain bar inventory by restocking beer, wine, liquor, ice, glassware, napkins, and straws.
* Clean and reset bar areas, workspaces, and tables.
* Prepare garnishes such as fruit slices and pits for drinks.
* Arrange and organize bottles and glasses for efficient and attractive presentation.
* Ensure cleanliness of all bar areas including counters, sinks, shelves, and storage areas.
* Report equipment issues and maintenance needs to the restaurant manager.
* Attend employee meetings and contribute suggestions for continuous improvement.
* Coordinate with colleagues to meet guest needs and support restaurant operations.
* Provide backup support in various roles to ensure exceptional guest service and operational efficiency.

**Supplemental:*** Organize and oversee the operations of a cocktail lounge or bar area as needed.
* Manage inventory by ordering and requisitioning liquors and supplies.
* Supervise and train bar staff and other bartenders.
* Create bar menus and develop new drink recipes.
* Prepare appetizers and snacks such as pickles, cheese, and cold meats.

**Tools and Technology:*** Point-of-sale terminals (POS), POS software, and workstations.
* Computers, tablets, smartphones, and handheld devices for order management and communication.
* Office suite software, back-office accounting systems, route planning tools, and web-based applications.
* Office equipment including fax machines, printers, phone systems, and barcode readers.
* Carbonated beverage dispensers, draught beer systems, and soda dispensers.
* Cocktail shakers, pour spouts, spirit measures, and various bartending tools.
* Commercial blenders, graters, cutlery, dishwashers, juicers, mixers, and strainers.
* Mist or trigger sprayers for drink preparation.
* Ice shaver machines, ice crushers, and ice flakers for preparing chilled beverages.
* Non-carbonated beverage dispensers and slush/frozen drink machines.


Pay Range: USD $21.00 - USD $25.00 /Hr.

title: Food Runner
description:
Position Overview:
**Now Hiring! Food Runner**

 **FLSA:** FT or PT available

**Pay Range:** $20 - $21 /hour

**Location:** Demarest, NJ 07627  

Alpine Country Club is currently looking for qualified individuals with a great personality and a passion to provide first class service. We offer a variety of employment opportunities, including seasonal full-time and part-time positions. If you wish to become part of a world class team, we invite you to apply.  

Our team at Alpine Country Club is one that embraces excellence, teamwork, and member satisfaction. Employee growth and advancement is rewarded and encouraged through training, empowerment, recognition, and career opportunities.*We are currently searching for* ***Food Runners*** *to join our team.* **Job Summary:**
Under the direction of the F&B Manager, a food runner is a dining room professional. A food runner is responsible for food and beverage service in the Alpine CC dining venues. The food runner will have familiarity with all types of service that Alpine CC provides for its members and guests. The incumbent is also responsible for knowledge of all food and beverage that is served at Alpine CC. Food runners are required to enthusiastically distribute food and beverage orders while interacting with our membership in a way that is consistent with Alpine CC standards.
The way food runners present themselves to members and non-members is critical. Appearance, proper verbal expression and demeanor are all variables of professional service. Proper etiquette and protocol must be followed while serving in a prompt efficient and friendly manner. All food runners shall adhere to the steps of service as the guideline for providing service.
"Personalizing" service by learning member's names and preferences should always be a priority for service staff. Food runners shall function under the concept of "one team" by helping others in all rooms and positions. An Alpine CC food runner has a keen ability to anticipate the needs of everyone that is in the dining venue.
A food runner is responsible for cleanliness and sanitation in the service staff areas. If the food runner is not certain about any procedure, technique, or standard, attention must be brought to the supervisor immediately. **Job Responsibilities**:* Provides members and their guests with friendly, efficient, and memorable service with the main focus on hospitality and making great experiences.
* Ensures proper setup and breakdown of all buffet equipment.
* Assists in the completion of all banquet events.
* Properly and efficiently delivers food orders to the corresponding table numbers and seat positions as directed by the Executive Chef and Lead Runner.
* Ensures compliance with alcoholic beverage control regulations and laws. Checks identification of those appearing underage and denies service when appropriate. Monitors individual consumption and alerts management to situations of concern.
* Has proficient menu knowledge and is familiar with all items and ingredients that are served at the club.
* Delivers food orders as directed.
* Proficiently enters and communicates food and beverage orders on a POS computer terminal or dupe check.
* Ensures proper sequencing/timing with kitchen, reports any delays or problems to supervisor.
* Serves each course using proper techniques.
* Participates in service briefings to ensure product knowledge.
* Assumes responsibility of side work and server station maintenance.
* Ensures room setups are accurate and complete.
* As directed, completes special assignments as requested by supervisor(s)

**Experience and Skills:*** Positive Attitude.
* Knowledge of service etiquette and protocol.
* Familiarity with computerized order systems.
* 2 years prior experience in bartending and food service.
* Familiarity with fine dining operations.
* Knowledge of service etiquette and protocol.
* Familiarity with computerized order systems.
* Ability to climb stairs and lift to 35 lbs. daily is required.
* Standing for long periods of time.
* Working split shifts and shifts that may exceed 12 hours in duration.
* Working various shifts including weekends and holidays.

  


Pay Range: USD $20.00 - USD $21.00 /Hr.

title: Host/Hostess
description:
Position Overview:
**Now Hiring, Host/Hostess!****Salary: $20/hr. - $23/hr.**  

  

**Job Summary:**  

  

Provide friendly, responsive service to create an exceptional dining experience for all of our guests, by welcoming and warmly greeting guests on arrival. Manage the efficient and timely seating of our guests to a table that best serves their wishes.  

  

**Activities and Responsibilities:**  

  

**Primary**  

* Warmly and graciously greet all members and guests and seat them at tables or in waiting areas.
* Provide members with menus and inform them of their server’s name upon seating.
* Record members names and the number of people in party and provide members with estimated waiting time when immediate seating is limited.
* Assign members to tables suitable for their needs and according to rotation so that servers receive an appropriate number of seatings.
* Locate waiting parties when tables become available.
* Speak with members to ensure satisfaction with food and service, to respond to complaints, or to make conversation.
* Answer telephone calls and respond to inquiries or transfer calls.
* Receive and record members' dining reservations.
* Maintain contact with kitchen staff, management, serving staff, and members to ensure that dining details are handled properly, and customers' concerns are addressed.
* Inspect dining and serving areas to ensure cleanliness and proper setup.
* Inform members of establishment specialties and features.
* Direct members to coatrooms and waiting areas such as lounges.
* Relay messages to servers and bussers as needed.
* Thank members as they leave and invite them to return.
* Attend all scheduled employee meetings and offers suggestions for improvement.
* Coordinate with and assist fellow employees to meet members’ needs and support the operation of the restaurant.
* Fill-in for fellow employees where needed to ensure guest service standards and efficient operations.

  

**Supplemental**  

* Take and prepare to-go orders.
* Supervise and coordinate activities of dining room staff to ensure that patrons receive prompt and courteous service.
* Assist with preparing and serving food and beverages.

  

**Tools and Technology**  

  

* Point-of-sale terminals, POS software, and workstations
* Personal computers, tablets, smart phones and/or handheld devices
* Software - Office suite, web-based applications, etc.
* Special purpose telephones
* Calendar and scheduling software
* Table management or reservation software

  

**Experience and Skills:**  

* Positive Attitude.
* Knowledge of service etiquette and protocol.
* Familiarity with computerized order systems.
* 1-year prior experience in food service.
* Familiarity with fine dining operations.
* Ability to climb stairs and lift to 35 lbs. daily is required.
* Standing for long periods of time.
* Working split shifts and shifts that may exceed 12 hours in duration.
* Working various shifts including weekends and holidays.

  

**Benefits:**  

* FT Seasonal employees are offered:
* Medical, dental, vision, supplemental benefits, and life insurance
* PTO and paid holidays
* All employees receive employee meals and uniforms.


Pay Range: USD $20.00 - USD $23.00 /Hr.

title: Golf Service Staff
description:
Position Overview:
**Now Hiring! Golf Service Staff**  


Salary: $18.00 - $20.00 Per Hour
Total Anticipated Compensation Up To: $20.00  

**Overview**  


To qualify for this full-time, seasonal position, applicants must have a positive attitude, be a team player, and have a desire to provide great customer service.  


Hospitality and service are the cornerstones of this position. The ability to lift at least 50lbs (golf bags) and a willingness to work outside and on the weekends/holidays are also required. Applicants must have reliable transportation.  

**Essential Responsibilities**  


The job will include typical outside service duties including but not limited to:* Greeting Alpine members and guests in a professional and courteous manner.
* Making sure water coolers are full with ice and are clean on a daily basis
* Communicate daily with Professional Staff and Golf Services Supervisor about events and operations.
* Assure golf cars are cleaned and washed per club procedures.
* Restock and rotate golf cars based on usage reports.
* Charge all golf cars on a daily basis.
* Maintain clean towels, including washing, drying, and folding.
* Upkeep of practice area and hitting stations.
* Follow hitting area rotation schedule.
* Restock hitting stations and pick range when needed.
* Maintain chipping area and putting green.
* Re-fill practice area bins in the evening in preparation for next day’s opening shift.
* Set up members and guest’s bags for play.
* Put away member and guest bags in proper storage location and in timely fashion.
* Maintain rental set inventory by keeping clubs and bags clean.
* Load bags and move golf cars to car staging area.
* Keep golf car staging area well stocked with carts throughout the day.
* Clean all players’ golf clubs thoroughly.
* Assure that all bags are tagged properly.
* Provide information on club policies and procedures, upcoming events, and rules of the day to members.
* Assist with managing of a digital tee sheet (Foretees).

**Benefits*** Staff Uniforms
* Playing privileges on selected days
* Meals while on duty
* Performance bonus
* Golf equipment discounts
* Opportunities for additional income during Golf Outings & Club repair.


Pay Range: USD $18.00 - USD $20.00 /Hr.

title: Server
description:

**Now Hiring, Server!****$21-$25/Hour**  

  

**Job Summary:**  

  

Provide friendly, responsive service to create an exceptional dining experience for all of our guests. Each server’s primary objective is to show our guests such a marvelous time, they will want to return.  

  

**Activities and Responsibilities:**

title: Pizza Chef
description:
Position Overview:
**Now Hiring! Pizza Chef***Job Description**Full time**Salary range: $21-$28**/hour***Job Summary**
---------------


The Pizza Chef will prepare and cook a variety of pizzas to perfection, consistently delivering delicious and authentic Italian flavors that delight our customers. This individual will work closely with the culinary team to ensure the quality and presentation of our pizzas meet our standards of excellence.***Supervisory Responsibilities:***
===================================

* None

**Duties/Responsibilities:**
----------------------------

* Prepares pizza dough, sauces, and toppings according to established recipes and procedures.
* Stretches and shapes pizza dough by hand or with a rolling pin to achieve the desired thickness and shape.
* Applies sauces, cheeses, and toppings in appropriate quantities and arrangements to ensure even distribution and balanced flavors.
* Cooks pizzas in a wood-fired oven or conventional oven, monitoring cooking times and temperatures to achieve optimal results.
* Collaborates with the culinary team to develop new pizza recipes and seasonal specials that showcase innovative flavors and ingredients.
* Experiments with different dough formulations, sauces, and toppings to create unique and memorable pizzas that set us apart from the competition.
* Ensures consistency in portion sizes, presentation, and flavor profiles across all pizza offerings.
* Maintains high standards of food quality, consistency, and presentation, conducting regular inspections of pizza ingredients and finished products.
* Addresses any issues or concerns regarding food quality or preparation techniques promptly and effectively.
* Monitors inventory levels of pizza ingredients and supplies, communicating with management to ensure adequate stock levels.
* Follows proper hygiene and handwashing procedures.
* Ensures prompt and accurate fulfillment of customer orders, coordinating with kitchen staff and front-of-house team members as needed.
* Handles customer inquiries, feedback, and complaints courteously and professionally, striving to exceed customer expectations with every pizza served.

**Required Skills/Abilities:**
------------------------------

* Strong culinary skills and a passion for Italian cuisine, particularly pizza making.
* Knowledge of traditional pizza dough formulations, baking techniques, and flavor combinations.
* Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment, maintaining composure under pressure during peak service times.
* Excellent attention to detail and a commitment to quality and consistency.
* Effective communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with other team members.
* Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed.

**Education and Experience:**
-----------------------------

* Proven experience as a Pizza Chef or similar role in a restaurant or food service establishment, with a focus on handcrafted pizza.

**Physical Requirements:**
--------------------------

* This role requires frequent mobility within the kitchen area, including moving between workstations, reaching for ingredients, and stretching pizza dough. The ability to stand and walk for extended periods is essential.
* Must be able to lift, bend, and stoop comfortably.
* Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds.
* Excellent manual dexterity is necessary for tasks such as shaping pizza dough, spreading sauce, and arranging toppings. The Pizza Chef should have strong hand-eye coordination and the ability to handle kitchen tools and equipment with precision.


Pay Range: USD $21.00 - USD $28.00 /Hr.

title: Lead Scientist, R&D Claims & Substantiation
description:
How function of Beauty Came to Function
  
Ever realized that your reflection is uniquely yours? Each detail speaks to your individuality. We saw a gap in the beauty industry’s acknowledgement of this uniqueness and stepped in. Function of Beauty celebrates you with tailor-made, naturally derived formulas, crafted by in-house chemists and beauty experts. Since 2015 we’ve created 15 million unique, customized products and counting…
  
  

**Position Summary:**  

The Lead Scientist, R&D Claims & Substantiation will ensure that competitive and compelling product claims are delivered to the pipeline of innovations for cosmetic products. They will lead scientific claims development and substantiation for labels and marketing materials, as well as support up-claim opportunities for existing products, ensuring compliance with regulations. This role involves close collaboration with Marketing, Formulation Development, Regulatory, Packaging, external testing laboratories, legal counsel, and suppliers. A strong understanding of cosmetic product formulation, claims, creativity, and business strategy is essential.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Partner with Marketing to develop claims for the projects pipeline.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align claims with marketing goals.
* Review and manage the claims approval process.
* Ensure compliance with regulatory standards and legal requirements.
* Design test strategies to support claims and ensure results are delivered on time.
* Prepare claims substantiation reports and technical memos.
* Conduct competitive claims landscaping.
* Suggest and design demos and new methodologies for claims substantiation.
* Manage sample production for in-vivo and in-vitro studies.
* Review clinical and in-vitro testing reports.
* Convert scientific findings into consumer claims.
* Organize claims materials into a claims database.
* Identify and support up-claim opportunities for the existing product portfolio.
* Build and manage partnerships with an external network of suppliers and laboratories to validate claims.


**Required Education, Skills, and Experience:**  

* Bachelor’s degree with 5+ years of experience, or a Master’s degree with 4+ years of experience in consumer goods, cosmetics, or a related field.
* Experience in claims design and substantiation for consumer products, such as hair care, skin care, and skin cleansers.
* Robust understanding of formulation technology and cosmetic chemistry.
* Knowledge of GxP and FDA compliance requirements.
* Excellent communication skills, including spoken and written English.
* Strong organizational skills.
* Ability to partner effectively across a diverse set of business partners and customers to deliver key results in a timely manner.
* Entrepreneurial mindset; a business owner mentality, willing to be hands-on and contribute as part of a team.
* Strong critical thinking skills and comprehensive business acumen.


**Desired Education/Certification:**  

* Experience with haircare claims substantiations is highly preferred.
* Previous regulatory experience is preferred.
* Experience in formulation/product/process development in the Cosmetic and/or Drug regulatory classifications.


**Physical Demands:**  

* Ability to manage and review claims-related documentation and testing reports.
* Ability to travel if needed (expected travel 5% of the time).


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
  
  

**Employment Category:**  

* Full Time, Exempt


**Compensation Range:**  

* $90K/yr - $120K/yr
* Hybrid work schedule: 4 days in the office and 1 day remote.


**Benefits and Perks:**  

* Company-sponsored benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision)
* HSA option with company contribution
* Infertility Coverage
* Additional Behavioral Health Support
* Comprehensive suite of virtual care options
* Paid Parental leave
* Company paid Disability and Basic Life Insurance
* Additional Voluntary Life insurance
* 401k with Company match
* Flexible Paid Time off policy, including Safe & Sick Time and Paid Holidays
* Commuter Benefits (Parking & Transit)

title: Influencer Associate
description:
How function of Beauty Came to Function
  
Ever realized that your reflection is uniquely yours? Each detail speaks to your individuality. We saw a gap in the beauty industry’s acknowledgement of this uniqueness and stepped in. Function of Beauty celebrates you with tailor-made, naturally derived formulas, crafted by in-house chemists and beauty experts. Since 2015 we’ve created 15 million unique, customized products and counting…
  
  

**Position Summary:**  

We are seeking a full-time Influencer Associate to outreach and engage a targeted list of influencers/creators to help grow Function of Beauty’s community and brand awareness. The Associate is a highly motivated and creative individual with experience and passion for influencer marketing to support the day-to-day strategy and execution. Responsibilities include identifying and engaging influencers, relationship building, managing seeding and tracking engagement and metrics. Additional responsibilities include supporting the Director, Influencer Marketing on other program needs such as support on campaign project management, creative briefs, product send outs, etc. The ideal candidate will have experience in influencer engagement and community building along with a passion for beauty and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment. This role reports into the Influencer Marketing Director.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Regularly identify and vet new and up-and-coming influencers for current and future programs.
* Build, track and maintain ongoing database of relevant influencers and creators for potential seeding and engagement
* Create and maintain meaningful relationships with influencers and build a network of influencer relationships that can serve as advocates for the brand and be a source for earned and paid executions
* Manage seeding logistics, including corresponding with influencers, submitting orders and coordinating with Ops team, to send all influencer and VIP packaging out for marketing initiatives
* Track content and metrics for evergreen and campaign influencer reporting; analyze and report on effectiveness of programs for key stakeholders
* Support off and online influencer engagements including experiential and influencer events.
* Provide input from ongoing conversations/relationships to help inform the larger influencer strategy and social content strategy
* Utilize tools, like Traackr, to put together influencer recommendations based on objectives and key metrics
* Support execution of paid influencer campaigns from contracts, product sends, creative briefs, and communication
* Stay on the pulse of cultural and social trends to identify new opportunities and partners
* Monitor competitive landscape, with the help of reporting tools, and help surface relevant insights and opportunities
* Become a familiar face/voice to our influencer community; execution on the Function tone of voice
* Work to help move forward influencer campaigns and logistics around through tactics such as: maintaining budget trackers, drafting/updating influencer contracts, updating campaign trackers, and additional necessary program details.
* Support Director, Influencer Marketing on day-to-day influencer needs


**Required Education, Skills, and Experience:**  

* 3+ years of experience in social media and influencer marketing or talent relations, beauty experience preferred
* Hard-working and self-motivated; strong desire to learn along with professional drive
* A natural networker - you love connecting with people; and have a knack for building and maintaining relationships
* Talent/influencer relationship experience; solid understanding of influencer marketing tactics and its best practices
* Experience working with influencer networks, individual influencers and influencer identification, management and measurement tools such as Traackr, CreatorIQ, DashHudson
* Experiencing in supporting paid social campaigns; strong understand of digital and content marketing strategies
* Excellent verbal and written and interpersonal communication skills
* Strong planning and organizational skills with high level of attention to details
* Positive can-do attitude; thrives on a fast paced, dynamic environment
* On the pulse of content trends and creators, familiar with influencers/content creators in the beauty, lifestyle and wellness space
* Self-starter with strong initiative and creative problem solving skills
* Excellent acumen of key social channels including Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, and YouTube
* Strong understanding of activity with the competitive beauty industry and social media landscape
* Proficiency in data analytics tools such as Dash Hudson, Sprout Social, Traackr/CreatorIQ, etc.
* Team player with ability to collaborate with broader Communications and cross-functional teams


**Desired Education/Certification:**  

* Bachelor’s Degree


**Employment Category:**  

* Full-Time, Exempt
* Hybrid work schedule


**Compensation range:**  

* $60-70k Annually


**Benefits and Perks:**  

* Company-sponsored benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision)
* HSA option with company contribution
* Infertility Coverage
* Additional Behavioral Health Support
* Comprehensive suite of virtual care options
* Paid Parental leave
* Company paid Disability and Basic Life Insurance
* Additional Voluntary Life insurance
* 401k with Company match

title: Registered Nurse Charge Nurse (RN)
description:
**Registered Nurse Charge Nurse (RN)**

  



Sans Souci Rehabilitation and Nursing Center is seeking a Registered Nurse Charge Nurse (RN) to join our team.


**Registered Nurse Charge Nurse (RN) Responsibilities:**

* **Patient Care Management:**
* Assess, plan, implement, and evaluate patient care plans in collaboration with physicians and other healthcare professionals.
* Monitor and manage patient progress, addressing changes in condition and implementing appropriate interventions.
* Ensure that all patients receive individualized care based on their needs and preferences.
* **Staff Supervision and Coordination:**
* Supervise and support nursing staff, including Registered Nurses (RNs), Licensed Practical Nurses (LPNs), and Certified Nursing Assistants (CNAs).
* Assign duties and manage work schedules to ensure adequate staffing and coverage.
* Provide guidance, training, and mentorship to nursing staff, fostering a collaborative and positive work environment.
* **Quality Assurance:**
* Ensure compliance with facility policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.
* Conduct regular audits and assessments to maintain high standards of care and identify areas for improvement.
* Address and resolve patient and family concerns, ensuring satisfaction and effective communication.
* **Documentation and Reporting:**
* Maintain accurate and timely documentation of patient care, including assessments, interventions, and outcomes.
* Prepare and submit reports on patient care, staff performance, and any incidents or concerns to facility management.
* **Emergency Response:**
* Respond to medical emergencies promptly and efficiently, coordinating with emergency response teams as necessary.
* Provide leadership during crisis situations, ensuring the safety and well-being of patients and staff.
* **Interdisciplinary Collaboration:**
* Work closely with physicians, therapists, social workers, and other healthcare professionals to develop and implement comprehensive care plans.
* Participate in interdisciplinary meetings and contribute to care planning and decision-making processes.
  

**Registered Nurse Charge Nurse (RN) Qualifications:**

* **Education:** Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree in Nursing from an accredited institution.
* **Licensure:** Valid Registered Nurse (RN) license in [State].
* **Experience:** Minimum of 2 years of nursing experience, with at least 2 years in a skilled nursing or long-term care setting preferred. Previous supervisory experience is a plus.
* **Skills:** Strong leadership, organizational, and communication skills. Ability to make sound clinical decisions and manage multiple priorities effectively.
* **Certifications:** Basic Life Support (BLS) certification required; Advanced Cardiovascular Life Support (ACLS) certification preferred.

 **Salary:** **Up to $52 an hour**

  


an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: RN weekend Supervisor
company: Arnold Walter Nursing and Rehabilitation Center
description:
**RN Weekend Supervisor (Part-Time)**  

**Location:** Arnold Walter Nursing and Rehabilitation Center  

**Shift:** 7:00 AM - 3:00 PM or 3:00 PM - 11:00 PM


**About Us:**  

At Arnold Walter Nursing and Rehabilitation Center, we are committed to providing compassionate and quality care to our residents. Our team of dedicated healthcare professionals works together to create a supportive and nurturing environment for everyone. We are currently seeking a skilled and experienced RN Weekend Supervisor to join our team on a part-time basis.


**Position Overview:**  

As the RN Weekend Supervisor, you will play a crucial role in supporting the Director of Nursing (DON) and Associate Director of Nursing (ADON) by overseeing the day-to-day functions of the Nursing Department during your shift. You will ensure that nursing services personnel are adhering to their job descriptions, participate in facility surveys, and contribute to the development and implementation of resident care plans.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Assist the DON and ADON in planning, organizing, implementing, and evaluating nursing department functions.
* Ensure compliance with current regulations, guidelines, and facility policies.
* Participate in facility inspections and surveys as requested.
* Contribute to the development and updating of resident care plans.
* Oversee and participate in LPN and CNA evaluations, disciplinary actions, and decisions regarding staffing.
* Communicate resident concerns and updates to physicians, families, and nursing administration.
* Ensure adequate staffing for quality care during each shift.
* Conduct daily rounds to monitor nursing staff performance and report findings to the DON.
* Address complaints and grievances, making appropriate reports as needed.
* Welcome and assist newly admitted residents.
* Participate in daily morning reports and Quality Assurance meetings.
* Assist with medication passes, treatment schedules, and direct nursing care.
* Ensure accurate and timely documentation, charting, and MDS completion.
* Monitor and assess residents for changes in condition, providing early intervention as needed.
* Oversee emergency equipment checks, narcotic counts, maintenance work orders, and room readiness for new admissions.
* Investigate accidents/incidents and ensure appropriate documentation to prevent abuse.
* Collaborate with social services on discharge plans and run PMP reports prior to discharge.


**Qualifications:**


* **Experience:** Minimum of two (2) years as a supervisor in a hospital, nursing care facility, or related healthcare setting. At least six (6) months of experience in rehabilitative and restorative nursing practices.
* **Licensure:** Must possess a current, unencumbered, active license to practice as a Registered Nurse in New Jersey.


**Additional Information:**  

This job description is not intended to cover every aspect of the role. Responsibilities and duties may change at any time, with or without notice.


**Why Join Us?**


* **Supportive Work Environment:** Be part of a team that values collaboration and compassionate care.
* **Professional Growth:** Opportunities for learning, development, and career advancement.
* **Competitive Compensation:** Offering a competitive salary and benefits package.


If you are a dedicated RN with a passion for providing high-quality care, we encourage you to apply. Join us in making a difference in the lives of our residents!


**Apply Today!**

title: Clerical Aide
description:
**Hopkins Center** is looking to hire for the **Clerical Aide** position. The main responsibility of this role is to coordinate transportation for resident appointments, ensuring that residents arrive at their medical appointments on time. Additionally, the Clerical Aide will assist the nursing and administrative staff with various tasks, including filing, data entry, and other administrative duties.


**Salary: $20/hr**


**Clerical Aide** **Key Responsibilities:**


* Coordinate and schedule transportation for residents' appointments, ensuring timely pick-up and drop-off.
* Communicate with transportation providers, residents, and families to confirm and update appointment details.
* Assist nursing staff with clerical duties such as filing and organizing medical records.
* Support the administrative team with general office tasks, including copying, scanning documents and data entry.
* Maintain accurate records of appointments and transportation schedules.
* Assist with other administrative tasks as needed to support the facility’s operations.


**Clerical Aide** **Qualifications:**


* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Previous experience in a clerical or administrative role preferred.
* Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook) and basic data entry.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Familiarity with a healthcare environment is a plus.

title: Universal Banker - Park Ave South
description:
**Job Title:** Universal Banker
  
**Job Classification:** Sales
  
**Department:** Retail Banking
  
**Status:** Non-exempt
  
**Reports To:** Branch Manager
  
  

**Hiring Range:** $47,000 - $58,000
  
  

**Serving Others is Our Passion:** As a growing member of the community for more than 90 years, Flushing Bank is dedicated to supporting and serving the individuals, families, professionals, and businesses in Brooklyn, Queens, Manhattan, and on Long Island.
  
  

**WE can offer YOU:** Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance, Short Term & Long Term Disability, Group Term Life, 401K Plus Employer Match, Paid Time Off, 11 Paid Holidays, Employee Referral Program, generous Incentive Programs, Volunteer Opportunities, and a Supportive Environment Focused on Learning and Advancement.
  
  

**General Statement of Duties:**  

You will be part of a team of professional individuals with a shared focus on delivering world-class customer service. You will be engaged in all aspects of customer interaction involving sales, service and transaction processing, focusing on building full banking relationships with current clients and prospects.
  
  

**Major Duties and Responsibilities:**  

* Proactively and professionally greet customers as they enter the branch and determine the best way to manage their experience.
* Engage with customers following established customer interaction model, to establish new customer relationships, retain and deepen existing customer relationships and provide highest customer service standards.
* Fulfill customer financial needs, both immediate and longer term, by utilizing needs-based selling to offer appropriate solutions and referring to business partners when necessary.
* Successfully and seamlessly accept and process deposits, payments, checks for cashing and other transactions.
* Recognize and cross-sell opportunities, including core deposit accounts as well as insurance and investment products. Refer to specialists as required.
* If properly licensed and certified to sell investments, perform required activities to achieve Investment sales goals. Establish effective partnership with the Financial Consultant.
* Engage in outbound calling and outreach activities to generate a consistent flow of qualified referrals and building a robust pipeline of sales opportunities.
* Establish proficiency of the Bank’s systems needed to effectively service customers with the highest of service standards.
* Meet or exceed all financial objectives pertaining to individual goals and branch team goals.
* Ensure compliance with all regulations, policies and procedures. Perform additional accountabilities required.
* Perform operational responsibilities as designated by management.
* Other duties as assigned.


Requirements
  
* Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance or related field, or comparable education and/or experience is required.
* A minimum of 2 years experience in a financial institution or comparable experience in a retail environment.
* The financial expertise and experience to offer product recommendations that will help customers with their immediate financial needs, as well as providing guidance to achieve their long term financial goals.
* Knowledge of financial institution operations, procedures and the ability to interpret and understand laws and regulations.
* Working knowledge of Windows, Microsoft Office, and multiple computer and software systems. Technology proficient for providing online and mobile banking demonstrations and understands how social media plays into today’s financial world.
* Polished interpersonal communication and client service and sales skills.
* Ability to apply strong analytical skills in reviewing data received from business partners.
* Effective communication skills including oral and written skills.
* The ability to work with all levels of management and staff.
* A high level of trustworthiness, professionalism, confidentiality, teamwork, and honesty in dealing with colleagues and customers.
* Securities and Life & Health Licensing a plus, but not required.


This is a non-exempt position, eligible for overtime if hours worked are over 40 hours.
  
The actual compensation will be based on qualifications, experience and other factors permitted by law.
  
EOE, including disability/veterans.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Overview:
**Job Purpose**

  

ICE ETF Hub is a platform that standardizes and simplifies the creation and redemption processes for Exchange Traded Products (ETP) through intuitive GUIs and APIs. ICE ETF Hub is utilized by liquidity providers, asset managers, transfer agents, distributors, and custodians in the US and Europe.

  

ICE is seeking a candidate who will work closely with internal and external business and technology partners to define requirements, and lead initiatives related to trade capture, order management, and execution.

 **Responsibilities**

* Develop a thorough understanding of ETP primary and secondary market workflows
* Produce detailed business and functional requirements based on user input and review of existing processes
* Lead and participate in design and implementation sessions with the development and quality assurance teams
* Attend industry events and client meetings, which may require travel
* Respond to technical and functional inquiries

**Knowledge and Experience**

* Detail oriented when documenting client requests and conversations
* Able to communicate effectively in writing, virtually, and in-person
* General knowledge of financial markets and products
* Bachelor’s degree required. A degree in finance or finance-adjacent major preferred.
* Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Familiarity with VBA, SQL and Visio is a plus.

**Schedule**

  

This role offers work from home flexibility of one day per week.

 **New York Base Salary Range**

  

The expected base salary for this role if located in New York City is between 87,600 - 128,800 USD. The base salary range does not include Intercontinental Exchange’s incentive compensation. While we provide this range as general guidance, at ICE we compensate employees based on the skillset and experience of the individual.

  

Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or ancestry, age, disability or veteran status, or other protected status.

  

#LI-RS1


#LI-Hybrid

title: Long Term Unit Manager Fulltime
description:
Birchwood Rehab Is now hiring a Long Term Unit Manager
  
  

Must have experience as a Unit Manager for skilled Nursing
  
  

Sign on Bonus $$
  
  

* Daily PAY\\*


Required Qualifications Minimum requirements include the following:
  
  

A nursing degree from an accredited college or university, Minimum two (2) years of experience providing direct care in long-term care, restorative or geriatric setting as an LPN/RN. Minimum (1) year of experience in nursing management. Current CPR Certification. Must also meet state requirements for relevant licensures or certifications and have no disciplinary action in effect against professional license. Major Duties and Responsibilities Plans, develops, organizes, implements, and directs nursing services for residents on the unit assigned. Ensures compliance with current applicable federal, state and local regulations and facility policies and procedures. Reviews complaints and grievances made or filed by staff. Makes appropriate reports to the Director of Nursing as required or as necessary. Ensures an adequate stock of medications, medical supplies, equipment, etc., is maintained on the unit at all times to adequately meet the needs of the resident and notifies appropriate personnel of needs. Assists in the development of written preliminary and comprehensive assessments of the nursing needs of each resident. Makes nursing/aide assignments as indicated. Encourages staff to attend and participate in outside training programs and schedules times as appropriate. Review nurses’ notes to ensure they are informative and descriptive of the nursing care being provided, that they reflect the resident’s response to the care, and that such care is provided in accordance with the resident’s wishes. Additional Assigned Tasks Treats all residents with dignity and respect. Promotes and protects all residents’ rights. Establishes a culture of compliance by adhering to all facility policies and procedures. Complies with standards of business conduct, and state/federal regulations and guidelines. Follows appropriate safety and hygiene measures at all times to protect residents and themselves. Maintains confidentiality of protected health information, including verbal, written, and electronic communications. Nursing Unit Manager - Job Description Updated: April 2023 Page 2 of 3 Reports noncompliance with policies, procedures, regulations, or breaches in confidentiality to appropriate personnel. Reports any retaliation or discrimination to HR or compliance officer. Reports any allegations of abuse, neglect, misappropriation of property, exploitation, or mistreatment of residents to supervisor and/or administrator. Protects residents from abuse, and cooperates with all investigations. Reports any occupational exposures to blood, body fluids, infectious materials, and/or hazardous chemicals in accordance with facility policy. Participates in all life safety and emergency drills and trainings. Fulfills responsibilities as assigned during implementation or activation of the facility’s emergency plan. Reports work-related injuries and illnesses immediately to supervisor. Follows established infection control policies and procedures. As a condition of employment, completes all assigned training and skills competency. Completes assigned portions of MDS. Attends care-plan meetings of assigned residents. Participates in QAPI or facility assessment activities as needed, such as carrying out duties assigned as part of a performance improvement committee Accepts licensed nurse assignments, as staffing needs require. Performs licensed nurse duties as assigned, in accordance with facility policies and procedures. Uses proper lifting and body mechanics while delivering care to residents. Personal Skills and Traits Desired/Physical Requirements/Working Conditions Ability to read, write, speak and understand the English language. Must be a supportive team member, contribute to and be an example of team work. Ability to make independent decisions when circumstances warrant such action. Ability to deal tactfully with personnel, residents, family members, visitors, government agencies/personnel and the general public. Must have patience, tact, and willingness to deal with difficult residents, family and staff. Must be able to relay information concerning a resident’s condition. Must not pose a threat to the health and safety of other individuals in the workplace. Must be able to move intermittently throughout the workday. Meets general health requirements according to facility policy, including medical and physical exams and checking immunity status to various infectious diseases. Ability to work beyond normal working hours and on weekends and holidays when necessary. Ability to assist in evacuation of residents during emergency situations. Ability to bend, stoop, kneel, crouch, perform overhead lifting and perform other common physical movements as needed for the position. May be subject to falls, burns from equipment, and/or odors throughout the day; encounter reactions from dust, tobacco smoke, disinfectants, and other air contaminants. Subject to exposure to infectious waste, diseases and/or conditions which include AIDS, Coronavirus, Hepatitis B, and Tuberculosis. May be subject to hostile or emotional residents, family members, visitors or personnel. Must possess leadership and supervisory ability and be willing to work harmoniously with and supervise other personnel. Ability to work beyond normal working hours and on weekends/holidays when necessary. Ability to work independently, and to organize, plan, and manage time effectively to complete assignments. Effective verbal and written communication skills. Strong listening skills and ability to deal with conflict with professionalism and courtesy. Basic computer skills, including ability to navigate electronic medical record systems. Positive interpersonal relationship skills, including with persons of all ages and cultures. Communicates with medical staff, nursing personnel, and other department heads. Subject to call back for emergency situations. Subject to work beyond scheduled working hours and on weekends and holidays as needed. Dexterity of hands and fingers to perform resident care

title: Associate, Infrastructure & Project Finance
description:
**Requisition ID:** 196562

**Salary Range:** 175,000.00 - 225,000.00

*Please note that the Salary Range shown is a guideline only. Salary offered may vary based on factors, including, but not limited to, the successful candidate’s relevant knowledge, skills, and experience.*

  

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 **Title: Associate, Infrastructure & Project Finance - New York, NY**

 **Global Banking and Markets**

  

Global Banking and Markets (GBM) is a leading Canadian Capital Markets and Investment Banking business with a growing platform in the US and Latin America, operating globally for over 100 years. Scotiabank’s strong U.S. presence provides our clients an important bridge to this key global market for trade and investment flows across the Americas and the world.

  

Global Banking and Markets provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange, and precious & metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.


Be part of an innovative, Global Capital Markets and Investment Banking business with a unique geographic footprint that puts capital to work for our clients across industries! We work together to drive ambition for every future!

 **Overview:**


The Infrastructure & Project Finance (“IPF”) team is part of Scotiabank Corporate and Investment (“CIB”) Division. IPF works closely with a wide range of industry coverage and product partners to originate, structure, and execute structured, acquisition, and project financings. IPF provides sector expertise, strategic advisory, and tailored financial solutions to our clients across developed and emerging markets. IPF’s primary focus is providing and arranging debt financing (e.g., greenfield and brownfield projects, corporate, acquisition) and debt advisory services for strategic owners and financial sponsors in the infrastructure space, including ports, airports, toll roads, public infrastructure, renewable energy, conventional power, transmission, digital infrastructure, and energy infrastructure across the Americas.

 **Position Highlights:**


Associates in Infrastructure & Project Finance enjoy a stimulating and challenging work environment in which they execute a broad range of transactions across various forms and sources of debt capital. Associates work on assignments ranging from origination to execution with various industry and product teams at the firm including: Power, Energy, Real Estate, Telecom, Technology, Debt Capital Markets, Global Loan Syndications, Derivative Products Group, Global Risk Management, and Sustainability Finance. Associate will work with colleagues in the United States, Canada, and with local banking teams in Latin America and the Caribbean. Associates will gain knowledge and understanding of bank lending, institutional debt capital markets, and derivative markets.

 **What You’ll Do**


At the early stages of their career, Associates’ responsibilities include preparation of client presentations, due diligence, financial modeling, research, reviewing and providing feedback to legal documentation, supporting internal credit approval processes and mentoring/supervising Analysts. A high degree of responsibility is afforded to those demonstrating initiative and the desire to take on such responsibility As the individual’s career progresses, Associates take on increased responsibilities on live transactions and participating in business development under the guidance of senior team members. Associates are in contact with senior team members and clients at the earliest possible stage, allowing them to gain experience in managing and cultivating relationships.


A significant amount of effort, diligence and initiative is required to properly execute assignments. The complexity of clients’ financial requirements coupled with the intense competitiveness of the banking industry necessitates a full commitment to the task at hand. Standards are very high as most work is presented to senior executives at client firms and supervision is provided only to the extent that it is required.


With a limited hierarchy of professionals and a small project team approach, an Associate has ample opportunity for career growth and development.  

  

New Associates may participate in the Capital Ideas Program, an intensive training program developed by Scotiabank. The program is designed to orient participants to our culture, people, products, and services and to provide the soft and technical skills, and contacts critical for success. Team projects, individual study, and social activities supplement classroom discussions.

  

As part of the Infrastructure & Project Finance team, the Candidate will, individually and as part of a team, execute the following primary responsibilities:

* Contribute, under supervision of senior team members, to debt raising activities and debt advisory assignments
* Support the due diligence process and preparation of credit presentations, Information Memorandum, and other documentation
* Support structuring and execution of bank and bond infrastructure financings, including contract negotiation, due diligence and consultant management
* Support credit risk and other internal approval processes for loans and counterparty exposures
* Assist capital structure and ratings advisory for infrastructure and project financings
* Develop, manipulate, and maintain project finance models
* Assist in managing transactions through the internal credit process by consultation, analysis, structuring, and communication with credit, regional, and business line managers
* Assist in maintaining and monitoring a portfolio of loans including, as needed, expansions, refinancings, restructurings, exits, etc., based on risk analysis
* Assist in transaction structuring and execution deals efforts with the partner groups and local teams, as applicable
* Support senior team members in negotiating financial structures, including where appropriate derivatives, debt capital markets solutions, and transaction documentation with clients
* Support the partner industry teams and relevant local teams in the preparation of internal credit analysis and comply with internal processes in accordance with the Bank's internal policies and procedures
* Support senior team members in ad hoc tasks

  

Major Activities Include:  

* Reviewing, analyzing, and commenting on due diligence materials and legal documentation
* Preparation of credit applications including a description of the transaction, presentation of the main features, especially focusing on risk and mitigant analysis
* Conducting detailed financial modelling and credit analyses
* Create marketing materials and presentations
* Prepare client presentations, including compiling data and assembling presentation materials
* Build relationships with clients, internal partners, and industry participants including financial, legal and technical advisors
* Collect, consolidate, and interpret company, project, and industry data
* Undertake comparable analysis and make structuring recommendations
* Perform financial and written analysis of companies and industries
* Work with various product teams in order to satisfy client’s needs
* Project and time management
* Provide ongoing credit monitoring and administrative requirements
* Confirm data integrity on Scotiabank’s systems (e.g. Salesforce, Credit 360, etc.)
* Applying industry and product knowledge to support designing financing solutions to help clients achieve their financial objectives
 **What You’ll Bring**

* Minimum 2-3 years of work experience in Corporate or Investment Banking, credit rating agency, or related experience
* Sector experience in power, energy, infrastructure preferred
* Bachelor or Master Degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Math, or Engineering
* Proven record of outstanding achievement in academic and extracurricular activities
* Strong quantitative skills focused on financial analysis, accounting, and credit risk
* Must have significant experience developing project finance models with Excel
* Must have significant experience creating marketing materials and presentations in PowerPoint
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* A high level of attention to detail
* Ability to manage multiple projects with different intensity levels simultaneously while maintaining a high standard of work
* Must be a self- starter and proactive by taking initiative and anticipating deal team needs
* Willingness to work hard and excel under pressure amid demanding deadlines
* Success working collaboratively in a team-based environment, underpinned by individual accountability
* Strong analytical, technical problem solving, time management, and organizational skills are a must
* High professional standards including a strong sense of personal integrity
* A demonstrated ability to adapt quickly and constructively to new situations and information
* A high level of energy, with keen desire to learn new concepts and embrace challenge
* Critical thinker, with demonstrated ability to take views and make decisions
* SIE, Series 63 & 79 preferred

 **Interested?**


At Scotiabank, every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are and, embraced for their differences. That’s why we work to grow and diversify talent and engage employees in a performance-oriented culture.

 **What's in it for you?**


Scotiabank wants you to be able to bring your best self to work – and life, every day. With a focus on holistic well-being, our many flexible benefit programs are designed to help support your unique family, financial, physical, mental, and social health needs.


Location(s): United States : New York : New York City


Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.


At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.
company_description: Scotiabank is the first Canadian company to be named to the “World’s Best Multinational Workplaces” list in 2014.

description:
Title:
Director, Corporate Underwriting - Mortgage or Structured Finance / Warren, NJ
Company:
Everest Global Services, Inc.
Job Category:
Underwriting
Job Description:
Everest Group, a NYSE listed S&P 500, is a leading global reinsurance and insurance provider, operating for nearly 50 years, now in over 15 countries. Everest is a growth company with $14 Billion of Gross Written Premium Offering Property, Casualty and Specialty products. We have extensive product and distribution capabilities backed by a strong balance sheet which is evident in our Financial Agency Ratings of: A+ A. M. Best, A+ S&P Global and A1 Moody’s Investor Service.
We take pride in being known in the industry as nimble, entrepreneurial, and responsive. Our culture is innovative, we empower our employees to make business decisions within our risk framework at a local level.
At Everest, we are committed to the development of our people. We offer dynamic training & professional development to our employees. You will benefit from career development and learning opportunities that will let you set career goals and fulfill them, including:* Generous tuition/continuing education reimbursement
* Mentoring opportunities
* Flexible work arrangements
* Talent development initiatives
* Networking groups


Job Summary:
Mortgage/structured finance analyst with prior experience in credit risk and cashflow analysis, able to add value in various areas such as new issue and surveillance of structured credit transactions, among other business-related initiatives.
Responsibilities include but not limited to:* Experienced residential and/or commercial mortgage, structured finance analyst able to support and add value to global underwriting units in the design and structuring of unique reinsurance and insurance structured credit transactions
* Run and create cash flow models and other analytical resources to support and add value to the pricing and analysis of risk
* Research/stay abreast of diverse topics such as housing, economy, regulations and mortgage finance related trends to evaluate and explain the risks in underwriting the transactions to internal and external stakeholders
* Perform aggregation of risk positions and data mining/trend analysis and across exposures in residential and commercial loans and structured credit transactions
* Perform and create tools/methods for ongoing surveillance/monitoring/accounting of existing business
* Prepare client and internal management presentations as well as general marketing material
* Work with brokers and MGA’s to negotiate deal related documentation
* Process rating agency/counterparty information requests
* Flexibility on travel required (mainly conferences, diligence meetings, client audits)


Qualifications, Education & Experience:* 5+ years of work experience
* Pursuit of CFA/FRM/MBA/Actuarial designation is preferred
* Past work experience at a commercial bank, investment bank, asset manager, REIT, mortgage insurer, financial guarantor, GSE, rating agency preferred
* Mortgage credit analysis background in at least one of: residential and/or commercial, multifamily, structured finance, structured surety
* Some knowledge of insurance/reinsurance/capital markets structuring/loss mitigation/capital relief
* Experience working with MGA’s, brokers preferred
* Understanding of regulatory capital across risk taking enterprises preferred


Knowledge, Skills & Competencies:* Able to express complex concepts in clear prose is required
* Ability to work in a very unstructured environment on multiple transaction/deliverables is required
* Self-motivated and team player; ability to take initiative and work with minimal supervision and interact across the organization as well as with external counterparties is required
* A creative problem solver – ability to analyze diverse, complex problems to understand transaction related risks/intricacies as well as ability to propose solutions is required
* Experience with R, VBA,SQL, and other programming languages is helpful
* Excel modeling/data mining skills, attention to detail is required
* Word, PowerPoint is required
* Research background helpful


#LI-RS1

Our Culture
At Everest, our purpose is to provide the world with protection. We help clients and businesses thrive, fuel global economies, and create sustainable value for our colleagues, shareholders and the communities that we serve. All colleagues are held accountable to upholding and supporting our values and behaviors across the company. This includes day to day interactions with fellow colleagues, and the global communities we serve.

title: Manager, Data Engineering
description:
Overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated individual to join our organization as the Manager of Data Engineering. As the Manager of Data Engineering within our Enterprise Data Platform (EDP) Data Operations Team, you will be responsible for overseeing and leading a team of data engineers to develop and maintain our data pipelines, data infrastructure and systems. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, analysts, and software engineers, to ensure efficient and reliable data integration, storage, and processing. This is a crucial role that requires technical expertise, leadership abilities, and a strategic mindset.
Responsibilities:
* Team Leadership: Lead and manage a team of data engineers, providing guidance, mentorship, and technical expertise. Set clear goals, establish priorities, and ensure successful project execution. Foster a collaborative and innovative work environment.
* Data Infrastructure Strategy: Develop and execute the data engineering strategy to support the organization's data needs, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance. Continuously evaluate and recommend new technologies, tools, and methodologies to optimize data engineering processes.
* Data Pipeline Development: Oversee the design, development, and maintenance of robust and scalable data pipelines for efficient data ingestion, processing, transformation, and storage. Ensure data quality and integrity throughout the pipeline.
* Data Modeling and Integration: Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to design and implement data models that support business intelligence, analytics, and reporting needs. Integrate data from various sources, both internal and external, ensuring compatibility and seamless data flow.
* Performance Optimization: Identify and address bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and data processing issues to optimize the performance and reliability of data systems. Monitor system performance, conduct regular capacity planning, and implement necessary optimizations.
* Data Security and Governance: Establish and enforce data security and governance policies and best practices to ensure data privacy, confidentiality, and compliance with regulatory requirements. Implement and maintain appropriate access controls and data protection measures.
* Collaboration and Communication: Foster effective collaboration and communication with stakeholders across the organization, including data science teams, business units, and executive leadership. Clearly communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Continuous Learning and Development: Stay updated with the latest trends, techniques, and advancements in data engineering, and facilitate knowledge sharing within the team. Encourage a culture of continuous learning and professional growth.


Qualifications:
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, data science, or a related field. Advanced certifications in data engineering or relevant domains are a plus.
* Proven experience (X+ years) in data engineering, including hands-on experience with data integration, data modeling, and ETL processes.
* Strong leadership skills with experience in managing and leading data engineering teams.
* Proficiency in programming languages like Python, SQL, and Java/C#. Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, and NoSQL databases.
* In-depth understanding of data warehousing concepts, data architecture, and cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Knowledge of data governance, security, and compliance practices.
* Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and troubleshooting skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment.

title: Investigative Analyst PD
description:
Overview:

At The New York Foundling, we trust in the power and potential of people, and we deliberately invest in proven practices. From bold beginnings in 1869, our New York-based nonprofit has supported hundreds of thousands of our neighbors on their own paths to stability, strength, and independence. We help children and families navigate through and beyond foster care. We help families struggling with conflict and poverty grow strong. We help individuals with developmental disabilities live their best lives, and we help our neighbors access quality health and mental health services—core to building lifelong resilience and wellbeing. Together, our interrelated programs provide a whole-person, whole-family, and whole-life approach that unlocks solutions for a lifetime.  

Reporting directly to the AVP of Investigations and Compliance in the Investigations and Program Quality unit of QPC, the Investigative Analyst has primary responsibility for the timely and rigorous investigation of the agency’s client-related incidents related to allegations of abuse, neglect, or mistreatment as well as quality of practice and program services. Analysts will work closely with program staff in the Developmental Disability (DD) Services and other divisions to support the implementation and maintenance of agency wide quality improvement and compliance efforts. The Investigative Analyst will work primarily with the DD division though there may be opportunity to support the Foundling’s other service lines. The Analysts will be based out of NY Foundling’s main office in Manhattan and will potentially be assigned to work on cases from any of the agency’s locations.  


Responsibilities:
**The New York Foundling is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse employee population, the Foundling will honor your experiences, perspectives and unique identity. Together, our community strives to create and maintain working and learning environments that are inclusive, equitable and welcoming.**  

* Review incident reports and identified allegations to determine appropriate next steps including reporting to external oversight agencies, opening investigations, and/or discussions with program staff.
* Complete investigations including interviewing program staff and service recipients, collection and review of relevant documentation to then determine investigative findings.
* Document investigative findings consistent within OPWDD regulations using Form OPWDD 149 consistent with best practices.
* Work with the AVP to develop client specific recommendations as well as program and system level recommendations based on investigation findings and incident management trends.
* Travel to all agency sites across NYC’s five boroughs and in Westchester, Rockland, and Orange counties as needed for interviews, site inspections, or meetings with program staff.
* Note that in this time of COVID 19, staff need to able to perform tasks remotely (as applicable) utilizing technology and equipment provided by the agency, including Teams to conduct interviews, collaborate with staff, participated in meetings and manage work; laptop connected to the internet; smart phones and the like
* Participate in the Incident Review Committee (based on availability) for the Developmental Disability (DD) Services Division as well as the DD Special Review Committee.
* Participate in trainings provided by OPWDD related to Incident Management (as determined).
* Must be/become certified to conduct Abuse/Neglect investigations by the NYS Justice Center.
* Additional assignments as delegated by AVP/Assistant Director.


Qualifications:
* Demonstrated strong commitment to safety
* Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to work with a wide variety of stakeholders and manage multiple deadlines and projects
* Willingness to work out of and travel among all agency sites to meet with program clients and staff
* Experience in investigations and/or social services, particularly Developmental Disabilities strongly preferred
* Experience with program evaluation, data analysis and report production
* Proficient in Microsoft Word, Teams, Zoom required


Education Required: Bachelor’s Degree from a U.S. accredited educational institution or Credential Evaluation for a non-U.S. educational institution
company_addresses: 590 Avenue of the Americas New York, NY 10011

At The New York Foundling, we trust in the power and potential of people, and we deliberately invest in proven practices. From bold beginnings in 1869, our New York-based nonprofit has supported hundreds of thousands of our neighbors on their own paths to stability, strength, and independence. We help children and families navigate through and beyond foster care. We help families struggling with conflict and poverty grow strong. We help individuals with developmental disabilities live their best lives, and we help our neighbors access quality health and mental health services—core to building lifelong resilience and wellbeing. The New York Foundling has served people with developmental disabilities since 1974, beginning with children and gradually expanding services to all ages, including the growing population of elders with developmental disabilities. The Developmental Division strives to empower people with intellectual and developmental disabilities to live as they choose, actively engaged in the community, pursuing their goals and interests through a choice of supported residential options, health services, meaningful activities, and employment opportunities.
